Interface Board

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleBoard
public interface Board
Defines the contract for the Tetris game board logic.

This interface abstracts the core mechanics of the game grid, including:

  • Collision detection and brick movement
  • Row clearing logic
  • State management (creating new games, restoring history)
  • Data retrieval for rendering

By using this interface, the GameController remains decoupled from the specific board implementation (e.g., SimpleBoard), adhering to the Dependency Inversion Principle.

  • Method Details

    • moveBrickDown

      boolean moveBrickDown()
      Attempts to move the active brick down by one row.
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful; false if the brick collided with the bottom or another block.

    • moveBrickLeft

      boolean moveBrickLeft()
      Attempts to move the active brick one column to the left.
      Returns:
      true if successful; false if blocked by a wall or stack.

    • moveBrickRight

      boolean moveBrickRight()
      Attempts to move the active brick one column to the right.
      Returns:
      true if successful; false if blocked by a wall or stack.

    • rotateLeftBrick

      boolean rotateLeftBrick()
      Attempts to rotate the active brick counter-clockwise. Implements wall-kick logic to adjust position if the rotation initially fails.
      Returns:
      true if the rotation (and potential wall-kick) was successful.

    • createNewBrick

      boolean createNewBrick()
      Spawns a new random brick at the top of the board.
      Returns:
      true if the new brick immediately collides with existing blocks (Game Over condition); false otherwise.

    • getBoardMatrix

      int[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Retrieves the raw 2D array representing the locked blocks on the board. Used by observers to render the background.
      Returns:
      a 2D integer array where values represent color codes (0 is empty).

    • getViewData

      ViewData getViewData()
      Captures a snapshot of the current board state for the View. This includes the active brick, ghost piece position, hold brick, and next bricks.
      Returns:
      a ViewData object containing all necessary rendering information.

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      void mergeBrickToBackground()
      Locks the current active brick into the board matrix. Called when a brick lands and can no longer move.

    • clearRows

      ClearRow clearRows()
      Scans the board for full rows, removes them, and shifts blocks down.
      Returns:
      a ClearRow object containing the number of cleared lines and the updated matrix.

    • newGame

      void newGame()
      Resets the board state for a fresh game. Clears the matrix, hold piece, and history.

    • hardDrop

      int hardDrop()
      Instantly drops the current brick to the lowest valid position.
      Returns:
      the number of rows the brick dropped (used for scoring).

    • holdCurrentBrick

      boolean holdCurrentBrick()
      Swaps the current brick with the held brick.
      Returns:
      true if the swap resulted in a Game Over (spawn collision); false otherwise.

    • restoreState

      void restoreState(int[][] savedGrid)
      Restores the board matrix to a previous state. Part of the Memento Pattern for the Undo functionality.
      Parameters:
      savedGrid - the 2D array from a BoardMemento.

    • resetCurrentBrick

      void resetCurrentBrick()
      Resets the position of the current brick to the spawn point. Used during Zen Mode board clears to maintain continuity.

    • isDangerState

      boolean isDangerState()
      Checks if any blocks have reached the "Danger Zone" (near the top of the board). Used to trigger visual and audio warnings.
      Returns:
      true if the stack height is critical.
